alert.note: Alert for Erie (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 3:04PM EST until February 18 at 3:37PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding due to ice jams and urban and small stream flooding is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western New York, including the following county, Erie. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. Depending on ice behavior, any release of the ice jam could result in sudden rises of water, leading to a rapid flooding situation. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 303 PM EST, Warm weather and associated snow melt along with rainfall will cause area creeks to continue to rise into this evening. This will result in ice jams at typically vulnerable locations. There also will be areas of standing water in low-lying areas. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.75 to 1.25 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, West Seneca, North Tonawanda, Clarence, Lackawanna, Kenmore, Depew, Amherst, Tonawanda, Lancaster, Hamburg, East Aurora, Williamsville, Grand Island, Evans, Elma, Boston, Eden and Marilla. - For more information visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Ice jams are unpredictable. River levels may fluctuate rapidly at any time.
